title: Consolidate domain logic from graph, validation, and labels modules
description:
## Problem

Significant domain logic is scattered across top-level modules that should be part of (or clearly connected to) the domain layer:

- **`graph.rs`**: `DependencyGraph` with cycle detection, topological sort, transitive reduction, path finding — core domain algorithms
- **`validation.rs`**: `IssueValidator` with type label enforcement, namespace registry rules — domain invariants
- **`labels.rs`**: `matches_pattern()`, `validate_label_operations()` — domain constraint logic

Meanwhile `domain.rs` (or `domain/` after 7004d5b6) is an anemic domain model with only data structures.

## Approach

After 7004d5b6 promotes `domain.rs` to `domain/`, re-export or relocate key domain operations so they're discoverable from the domain layer:

1. Re-export `DependencyGraph` from `domain/` module (or move if feasible)
2. Re-export `IssueValidator` from `domain/`
3. Re-export key label functions from `domain/`
4. Update `lib.rs` exports so library consumers find domain operations in one place

Note: Full relocation may not be practical in one step. Re-exports from `domain/mod.rs` are an acceptable intermediate step.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `use jit::domain::*` gives access to types AND key operations (graph, validation, labels)
- [ ] No breaking changes to existing imports
- [ ] All existing tests pass
